alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 2:12PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE RAFAEL BURN SCAR... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...In the Rafael Burn Scar near the border of Yavapai and Coconino County. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks, normally dry washes, and across the burn scar is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 209 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Verde River, Sycamore Creek, JD Dam Wash, Spring Creek, Coffee Creek, Railroad Draw and Tule Tank Wash. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Coconino and Yavapai Counties near the Rafael Burn Scar. - This includes the following swimming holes... Parsons Spring. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain.
